column4: just ask your question... otherwise how do we know if we can help?
i made this: apt-get install ntp -> ok then i tried to start ntpd but it dosent work
do you get any error messsages when you start ntpd? (and are you running Warty?)
I think you need to install ntpserver also... (you probably used apt-get and didnt install recommended packages, right?)
yes warty...what is the name of that package?
i did not find ntpd or similar package...
I dont think you're supposed to run ntpd yourself... try "sudo /etc/init.d/ntpdate restart"
I was probably wrong - but I remember installing ntp + ntpserver on debian
then do "ps -ef | grep ntpd" to see if it is running
then I am out of ideas - you installed ntp and ntpdate?
yes..i hawe done this many times in mdk and debian...
does it work in your computer?
strange...ok thanks...i have to take maybe base-config again..
